text: The harder you work, the luckier you get.
author: Gary Player

text: Dream big and dare to fail.
author: Norman Vaughan

text: No pain, no gain.
author: Unknown

text: Work until your idols become your rivals.
author: Unknown

text: Strive for progress, not perfection.
author: Unknown

text: Push yourself because no one else will.
author: Unknown

text: Success is the sum of small efforts repeated daily.
author: Robert Collier

text: Hard work beats talent when talent doesn’t work hard.
author: Tim Notke

text: Great things never come from comfort zones.
author: Unknown

text: Don’t stop when you’re tired; stop when you’re done.
author: Unknown

text: Your limitation—it’s only your imagination.
author: Unknown

text: Push yourself, because no one else is going to do it for you.
author: Unknown

text: Do something today that your future self will thank you for.
author: Unknown

text: Believe you can and you’re halfway there.
author: Theodore Roosevelt

text: Don’t wait for opportunity. Create it.
author: Unknown

text: Your only limit is you.
author: Unknown

text: Act as if what you do makes a difference. It does.
author: William James

text: Small daily improvements are the key to staggering success.
author: Unknown

text: Stay foolish to stay sane.
author: Maxime Lagace

text: What you get by achieving your goals is not as important as what you become by achieving your goals.
author: Zig Ziglar

text: Happiness is a choice.
author: Unknown

text: For every minute you are angry you lose sixty seconds of happiness.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

text: Happiness depends upon ourselves.
author: Aristotle

text: The purpose of our lives is to be happy.
author: Dalai Lama

text: Happiness is not by chance, but by choice.
author: Jim Rohn

text: Count your age by friends, not years. Count your life by smiles, not tears.
author: John Lennon

text: Smile, breathe, and go slowly.
author: Thich Nhat Hanh

text: Happiness is a warm puppy.
author: Charles M. Schulz

text: Do more of what makes you happy.
author: Unknown

text: Enjoy the little things in life.
author: Unknown

text: Tears come from the heart, not from the brain.
author: Leonardo da Vinci

text: Every human walks around with a certain kind of sadness.
author: Brad Pitt

text: Sadness flies away on the wings of time.
author: Jean de La Fontaine

text: The word 'happy' would lose its meaning if it were not balanced by sadness.
author: Carl Jung

text: Heavy hearts, like heavy clouds in the sky, are best relieved by the letting of a little water.
author: Christopher Morley

text: It’s okay to cry. It’s okay to feel sad. You are human.
author: Unknown

text: Sometimes you have to accept the truth and stop wasting time on the wrong people.
author: Unknown

text: The walls we build around us to keep sadness out also keeps out the joy.
author: Jim Rohn

text: Don’t grieve. Anything you lose comes round in another form.
author: Rumi

text: Even the darkest night will end and the sun will rise.
author: Victor Hugo

text: Love isn’t something you find. Love is something that finds you.
author: Loretta Young

text: Being deeply loved by someone gives you strength, while loving someone deeply gives you courage.
author: Lao Tzu

text: Love all, trust a few, do wrong to none.
author: William Shakespeare

text: Where there is love there is life.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

text: Love is composed of a single soul inhabiting two bodies.
author: Aristotle

text: We accept the love we think we deserve.
author: Stephen Chbosky

text: Love yourself first and everything else falls into line.
author: Lucille Ball

text: The best thing to hold onto in life is each other.
author: Audrey Hepburn

text: Love is when the other person’s happiness is more important than your own.
author: H. Jackson Brown, Jr.

text: To love and be loved is to feel the sun from both sides.
author: David Viscott

text: Romance is the glamour which turns the dust of everyday life into a golden haze.
author: Elinor Glyn

text: A true romantic is someone who is not afraid of love.
author: Unknown

text: Romance is thinking about your significant other, when you are supposed to be thinking about something else.
author: Nicholas Sparks

text: Love is the poetry of the senses.
author: Honoré de Balzac

text: Romance is the icing, love is the cake.
author: Unknown

text: You don’t marry someone you can live with — you marry someone you cannot live without.
author: Unknown

text: Romance is the quest for the never-ending adventure with your loved one.
author: Unknown

text: Romance is simply a way of keeping love alive.
author: Unknown

text: Romance is the spice of love.
author: Unknown

text: Romance is the art of expressing affection.
author: Unknown

text: Success usually comes to those who are too busy to be looking for it.
author: Henry David Thoreau

text: Don’t be afraid to give up the good to go for the great.
author: John D. Rockefeller

text: Success is not in what you have, but who you are.
author: Bo Bennett

text: The road to success and the road to failure are almost exactly the same.
author: Colin R. Davis

text: Success is walking from failure to failure with no loss of enthusiasm.
author: Winston Churchill

text: Opportunities don’t happen. You create them.
author: Chris Grosser

text: Don’t wait. The time will never be just right.
author: Napoleon Hill

text: Success is liking yourself, liking what you do, and liking how you do it.
author: Maya Angelou

text: Some people dream of success, while others wake up and work hard at it.
author: Unknown

text: Success is the sum of small efforts repeated day in and day out.
author: Robert Collier

text: Self-esteem comes from being able to define the world in your own terms and refusing to abide by the judgments of others.
author: Julius Erving

text: You yourself, as much as anybody in the entire universe, deserve your love and affection.
author: Buddha

text: Low self-esteem is like driving through life with your handbrake on.
author: Maxwell Maltz

text: Self-esteem is the reputation we acquire with ourselves.
author: Nathaniel Branden

text: Confidence comes not from always being right but from not fearing to be wrong.
author: Peter T. Mcintyre

text: The opinion which other people have of you is their problem, not yours.
author: Unknown

text: Love yourself enough to set boundaries.
author: Unknown

text: Act as if you are already the person you want to become.
author: Unknown

text: Self-worth comes from one thing – thinking that you are worthy.
author: Wayne Dyer

text: Respect yourself enough to walk away from anything that no longer serves you.
author: Unknown

text: The future belongs to those who believe in the beauty of their dreams.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

text: Do not wait to strike till the iron is hot; but make it hot by striking.
author: William Butler Yeats

text: The best way to predict your future is to create it.
author: Peter Drucker

text: Your future is created by what you do today, not tomorrow.
author: Unknown

text: You are never too old to set another goal or to dream a new dream.
author: C.S. Lewis

text: The future depends on what you do today.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

text: Don’t let the fear of losing be greater than the excitement of winning.
author: Robert Kiyosaki

text: The only limit to our realization of tomorrow is our doubts of today.
author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

text: You cannot escape the responsibility of tomorrow by evading it today.
author: Abraham Lincoln

text: Your big opportunity may be right where you are now.
author: Napoleon Hill

text: Growth is never by mere chance; it is the result of forces working together.
author: James Cash Penney

text: Without continual growth and progress, words like improvement, achievement, and success have no meaning.
author: Benjamin Franklin

text: Don’t go through life, grow through life.
author: Eric Butterworth

text: The only way to make sense out of change is to plunge into it, move with it, and join the dance.
author: Alan Watts

text: We cannot become what we want by remaining what we are.
author: Max DePree

text: Life is growth. If we stop growing, technically and spiritually, we are as good as dead.
author: Morihei Ueshiba

text: Intellectual growth should commence at birth and cease only at death.
author: Albert Einstein

text: Growth is painful. Change is painful. But nothing is as painful as staying stuck somewhere you don’t belong.
author: Mandy Hale

text: Challenges are what make life interesting; overcoming them is what makes life meaningful.
author: Joshua J. Marine

text: Continuous effort — not strength or intelligence — is the key to unlocking our potential.
author: Winston Churchill
